definition[0]: a group of people or companies who join together in order to achieve a particular aim
definition[1]: to arrange for written work, photographs etc to be sold to a number of different newspapers, magazines etc
example[1]: His column is syndicated throughout America.
definition[2]: a group of people or companies that work together to achieve a particular aim
example[2]: a bankingsyndicate led by the Hong Kong Bank of Australia
example[3]: The publishing group has bought a 45% stake, joining the companyâ€™s shareholder syndicate.
definition[3]: if a company, especially a bank or insurance company, syndicates a loan, debt etc, it provides the loan, debt etc with a group of other companies
example[4]: Some of the largest loans were syndicated to smaller creditors.
definition[4]: to arrange for articles, photographs, or radio or television programmes to be sold to several newspapers, television stations etc
example[5]: The broadcasting station asked him to put together a talk show that could be syndicated nationally.
